assetSummaries.displayName: ASI: WordPress Core Multiple CVEs for SQLi and Stored XSS
assetSummaries.description:
##### Description

This impacts all versions of WordPress major release branches from 3.7 to 5.8 and consists of the following CVEs:
-   CVE-2022-21664: SQL injection due to improper sanitization in WP_Meta_Query  
    Due to lack of proper sanitization in WP_Meta_Query, there’s potential for blind SQL Injection
-   CVE-2022-21661: SQL Injection through WP_Query  
    Due to improper sanitization in WP_Query, there can be cases where SQL injection is possible through plugins or themes that use it in a certain way.
-   CVE-2022-21663: Authenticated Object Injection in Multisites  
    On a multisite, users with Super Admin role can bypass explicit/additional hardening under certain conditions through object injection.
-   CVE-2022-21662: Stored XSS through authenticated users  
    Low-privileged authenticated users (like author) in WordPress core are able to execute JavaScript/perform stored XSS attack, which can affect high-privileged users.

##### Related Intelligence
CVE: [CVE-2022-21661](https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2022-21661)
CVE: [CVE-2022-21662](https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2022-21662)
CVE: [CVE-2022-21663](https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2022-21663)
CVE: [CVE-2022-21664](https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2022-21664)
Security Advisory: [WordPress.org](https://wordpress.org/news/2022/01/wordpress-5-8-3-security-release/)
PoC: [Exploit-DB](https://www.exploit-db.com/exploits/50663)
Writeup: [Zero Day Initiative](https://www.zerodayinitiative.com/blog/2022/1/18/cve-2021-21661-exposing-database-info-via-wordpress-sql-injection)
Writeup: [Medium article - written in Vietnamese](https://cognn.medium.com/sql-injection-in-wordpress-core-zdi-can-15541-a451c492897)

##### Remediation

Update to the latest minor release of your WordPress instance by logging in to the admin dashboard and clicking Update WordPress under the Updates screen. See [this page](https://wordpress.org/support/article/updating-wordpress/) if you run into issues. The makers of WordPress also strongly recommend enabling auto-update by following [these instructions.](https://wordpress.org/support/article/configuring-automatic-background-updates/)

The [WordPress_Versions](https://codex.wordpress.org/WordPress_Versions) page is a great resource to find the latest minor version for specific release branches.  Ensure the version you are running has a release date of January 6, 2022 or greater.
